name: Bourbon Basics Whiskey Tasting // West Village
description:
Let's get down to basics. Maybe you've heard that Bourbon can only be made in Kentucky. Maybe you're sick of ordering Bulleit because you can't think of another Bourbon you like. Maybe you've never even tried brown liquor. Whatever your situation, this is the place to start.

Bourbon Basics is a great way to get into whiskey as a beginner, or to develop your appreciation for spirits. Each guest will learn about three different American whiskeys that host Harry picks by getting to know you with complimentary tastings that will educate and expand your palate, ending in a final parting shot.

This is a whiskey tasting for the beginner or intermediate enthusiast. Harry has chosen whiskeys for hundreds of palettes and made new friends every step of the way. Through his experience you'll get insider access to his process and the tools you need to pick whiskeys of your own either when you're out at bars and the list seems impossibly long or when you're looking for a gift for that lovable snob in your life.

name: A Tour of Italy: Cooking Class // Greenwich Village
description:
What better way to explore a city than by discovering its cuisine first hand? Put on a chef's hat for the day and learn how to make classic dishes, local specialties and impressive plates with our expert hosts. Sign up for one of our fun, immersive cooking classes and discover a new hidden talent!

Can’t go to Italy this season? Pick the next best thing: a culinary tour of the belpaese while learning the best of regional cuisine. Start your journey by preparing a Tuscan pappa al pomodoro, a thick belly warming tomato and bread soup heaped with fresh basil and shaved parmigiano reggiano and extra virgin olive oil. Then travel south to Napoli making bite sized veal and ricotta meatballs to be served with pan roasted vegetables and balsamic reduction from Modena in Emilia Romagna, stopping by Roma to concoct a side of fluffy gnocchi alla romana, the pillowy semolina patties found on sunday’s italian tables. Finish strong heading for Piemonte and Friuli to craft a luscious Amaretto tiramisu’. No passport needed. • 2 hours of preparation and cooking followed by 1 hr sit down lunch or dinner. Wine is on the house! • Culinary studio located in the heart of Greenwich Village in a classic turn of the century apartment • Separate European style dining room which accommodate up to 8 people sitting at the communal table

name: Afternoon Plant-Based Lebanese Cooking Class & Lunch // Greenwich Village
description:
What better way to explore a city than by discovering its cuisine first hand? Put on a chef's hat for the day and learn how to make classic dishes, local specialties and impressive plates with our expert hosts. Sign up for one of our fun, immersive cooking classes and discover a new hidden talent!

Cook with a local and learn how to make a plant based Middle Eastern meal at this Greenwich Village home with amazing views of the NYC skyline. The class will commence with host Mary introducing several vegetarian recipes that she will share with you in this hands-on class. After the class, all guests will enjoy the fruits of their labor at a sit down meal. Aperitif Served. Guests can BYOB!

name: Bartender's Signature Cocktail Class // West Village
description:
What better way to explore a city than by discovering its cuisine first hand? Put on a chef's hat for the day and learn how to make classic dishes, local specialties and impressive plates with our expert hosts. Sign up for one of our fun, immersive cooking classes and discover a new hidden talent!

First you'll have a little chat about cocktails. Harry wants to know your experience and interest in the field. Are you a complete novice looking to make more informed cocktail choices? Are you a professional who wants to push their knowledge to the next level? Somewhere in between? This can take anywhere from 5-15 minutes, and will include a little context from Harry's explanation about where the Old Fashioned comes from. He'll also make you an old fashioned so you can experience it from every sense! After a briefing on tools and ingredients, you make your own! You can either go off one of his recipes, or take his ingredients and get creative. This part can take anywhere from 15-45 minutes, depending on experience. Harry has a multitude of ingredients guests can choose from, so you won't necessarily be limited to one. Lastly, you'll cheers! Everyone takes their original Old-Fashioned recipe, and celebrate their new appreciation for a timeless classic.

name: Pasta Workshop & Dinner // Greenwich Village
description:
What better way to explore a city than by discovering its cuisine first hand? Put on a chef's hat for the day and learn how to make classic dishes, local specialties and impressive plates with our expert hosts. Sign up for one of our fun, immersive cooking classes and discover a new hidden talent!

Learn how to prepare 3 different kind of pastas from scratch from the pros at Red Inside Culinary Studio! • 2 hours of preparation and cooking followed by 1 hr sit down lunch or dinner. Wine is on the house! • Culinary studio located in the heart of Greenwich Village in a classic turn of the century apartment • Separate European style dining room which accommodate up to 8 people sitting at the communal table

name: Pasta with Homemade Sauce Cooking Class & Multi-course Italian Dinner in Greenwich Village
description:
What better way to explore a city than by discovering its cuisine first hand? Put on a chef's hat for the day and learn how to make classic dishes, local specialties and impressive plates with our expert hosts. Sign up for one of our fun, immersive cooking classes and discover a new hidden talent!

Cook with a NYC local that grew up Italian and has been cooking Italian food her entire life. Mary is an expert at jarring tomatoes, making fresh pasta and sauces like pesto, marina, Cacio e Pepe and clam sauce. You will learn these new recipes at this Greenwich Village home with lovely skyline views and may be able to dine on the roof. This is a hands-on class, but customizable for those that would prefer to take more notes and enjoy the sit down meal. Most of the ingredients are purchased from the Union Square Farmer's Market where all the best NYC Chefs shop.

name: Bread & Pastry Making Class // Greenwich Village
description:
What better way to explore a city than by discovering its cuisine first hand? Put on a chef's hat for the day and learn how to make classic dishes, local specialties and impressive plates with our expert hosts. Sign up for one of our fun, immersive cooking classes and discover a new hidden talent!

Bake your own bread with Ivan! Learn the secrets behind bread making to bring home with you. While the bread is baking - learn to make mixed fruit tarts! • 2 hours of preparation and cooking followed by 1 hr sit down lunch or dinner. Wine is on the house! • Culinary studio located in the heart of Greenwich Village in a classic turn of the century apartment • Separate European style dining room which accommodate up to 8 people sitting at the communal table

name: Plant-Based Lebanese Cooking Class // Greenwich Village
description:
Join the latest culinary trend of immersive and social dining where local hosts invite you into their homes for a magical meal.

Cook with a local and learn how to make a plant based Lebanese meal at this Greenwich Village home with amazing views of the NYC skyline. The evening will commence with host Mary introducing several vegetarian recipes that she will share with you in this hands-on class. After the class, all guests will enjoy the fruits of their labor with a sit down dinner. Aperitif Served. Guests can BYOB!

name: A Man and his Sandwich Tour // East Village
description:
Discover a different side to a city on an immersive food walk and market tours. Our local hosts will show you all their favorite places to eat, drink and have fun!

There’s nothing quite like a great New York sandwich! Welcome to A Man and His Sandwich! Get ready to explore the historic neighborhoods of New York on one of the best food tours you'll ever experience. Join your fellow sandwich squad on this fun and delicious food tour around East Village with NYC sandwich-superfan Ben! As you eat from local restaurants and hidden gems, you'll learn about the history of the people who created the sandwiches you are eating, and discover how some sandwiches became signature New York dishes. Come with an open mind, and leave with a FULL stomach (and an answer to whether or not a hotdog, a burger or a taco is a sandwich).

name: Viva Esapana - make your own tapas
description:
What better way to explore a city than by discovering its cuisine first hand? Put on a chef's hat for the day and learn how to make classic dishes, local specialties and impressive plates with our expert hosts. Sign up for one of our fun, immersive cooking classes and discover a new hidden talent!

Make your own Spanish food - tapas, paella, and crema catalana! • 2 hours of preparation and cooking followed by 1 hr sit down lunch or dinner. Wine is on the house! • Culinary studio located in the heart of Greenwich Village in a classic turn of the century apartment • Separate European style dining room which accommodate up to 8 people sitting at the communal table About your host: Ivan is a pro chef from Italy currently living in the United States. He is a Master Chef in Italian Cuisine certified by Academia Barilla. Ivan has been nominated Best Chef America 3 years in a row and have been published on the New York Times and other national publications numerous times.

name: Great Irish Fair of New York
Explore Manhattan from above in a spectacular adventure
description:
The city's best views are on The Empire tour. Explore Manhattan from above in a spectacular adventure. 



 



The Empire tour is our most extensive. This 30-minute tour features all the magical moments of The Manhattan and The Big Apple, along with gorgeous views of Brooklyn, Coney Island, the Verrazano Bridge, and more : 



 





  • Coney Island 




  • Brooklyn




  • New Jersey




  • Northern tip of Manhattan




  • Verrazano Bridge




  • Central Park Columbia University 




  • Yankee Stadium (unavailable during games) 




  • New Jersey Palisades 




  • George Washington  Bridge 




  • Statue of Liberty 




  • Freedom Tower




  • Chrysler Building 




  • Empire State Building 




  • Chelsea Piers




  • Intrepid Sea, Air & Space Museum

name: NY helicopter tour
description:
Immediate takeoff towards the sky of New York. Fly over southern Manhattan and its emblematic monuments.



 



Take off and see the Statue of Liberty, the Freedom Tower, the tallest in New York, Ellis Island, Battery Park, the Brooklyn Bridge and Governors Island.



 



Enjoy the most popular helicopter flight in the world and take in the amazing view from the helicopter.



Click and fly! 



 



 



Check in 1h15 before takeoff.



Take the NJ Path train to Journal Square in Jersey City or NJ Transit to Newark Penn Station, then take an Uber or cab to the hangar.

name: Joyce Gold History Tours of NYC
NYC Pride March
shortDescription: New York City celebrates the freedom and rights of the gay community with a world-renowned week of celebrations, culminating in the famous NYC Pride March down Fifth Avenue with more than a million spectators lining the route. This event is recognized as one of the world’s best Gay Pride celebrations.
description: New York City celebrates the freedom and rights of the gay community with a world-renowned week of celebrations, culminating in the famous NYC Pride March down Fifth Avenue with more than a million spectators lining the route. This event is recognized as one of the world’s best Gay Pride celebrations.

name: KHAN-TOKE Modern Northern Thai Lunch // Midtown
description: Join host Gameka in this unique experience of KHAN-TOKE, which is a pedestal tray commonly used by the Lanna people of Northern Thailand. This will include varieties of Nam-Prik, which are selections of Thai chili paste commonly served with sticky rice and fresh vegetables. This is known as "the uncommon serving" of Thai style cuisine in the States. Let's step into this immersive experience that we can guarantee you have not encountered before.

name: Multi-Course Outdoor Balkan Feast // LIC
description:
Join the latest culinary trend of immersive and social dining where local hosts invite you into their homes for a magical meal.

Take a trip with Vlada & Ian to Eastern Europe with this multi-course Bulgarian feast in Long Island City, Queens. Upon arrival guests will be greeted with a welcome cocktail followed by 5-courses of Bulgarian specialties and favorites that are well known to the country. Vlada, being a Bulgarian native, will walk the guests through the origin of each dish while putting her own spin on traditional recipes, and cultivating a unique experience in a fun and friendly atmosphere. Ian & Vlada love to host and meet new people and cannot wait to welcome you into their Long Island City home. Prepare for a pun-filled menu and bring any drinks, if you so desire!

name: 5-course Taste of Modern Northern Thai Cuisine // Midtown
description:
Join the latest culinary trend of immersive and social dining where local hosts invite you into their homes for a magical meal.

Step in the flavors of Northern Thailand in heart of NYC with this 5 course dinner. Guests will be served family-style dinner with selections of Northern Thai Cuisine that are uncommon in the States. These 5 courses range from starters - to - desserts. Guests can bring their own bottle of wine.

name: New York Bagel Tour // Bryant Park
description:
Discover a different side to a city on an immersive food walk and market tours. Our local hosts will show you all their favorite places to eat, drink and have fun!

Experience New York like a native as you eat your way through three of the best bagel shops in the city! On this tour, you'll eat bagels like never before as you explore the history of the iconic New York food. Tour price is inclusive of food. You'll sample a variety of bagels, cream cheeses, and a classic sandwich like a BEC or a fully loaded lox! Everything is cut into ¼ so you can sample a wide variety throughout the tour (traditional, vegetarian, and vegan options available). We'll start at an award-winning shop making traditional hand-rolled, kettle-boiled bagels. From there, we'll indulge in the crème de la crème of cream cheese. Finally, we'll conclude with an innovative Montreal-New York hybrid style bagel. As a licensed tour guide and bagel expert, Sam has designed this tour to provide visitors a quintessential New York experience, and local foodies a new perspective on a food synonymous within their city. The private bagel tours are the ultimate team bonding experience, perfect for a corporate outing or offsite for up to 40 people. Sam and team will customize start time, locations, and mode of transportation for you. Message for more details. Don't see availability that works for you? Message the team and they will work something out!

name: Seasonal Japanese Inspired Seafood Tasting Menu // Brooklyn
description:
Join the latest culinary trend of immersive and social dining where local hosts invite you into their homes for a magical meal.

Japanese-inspired seafood tasting menu, crafted with seasonal, locally-sourced vegetables and seafood with a touch of Japanese herbs and spices ! This 8 to 11-course seafood tasting menu that rotates seasonally; Menu is subject to change based on availability at the farmer's market. This event is BYOB.

name: Chocolate Truffle Making Class in a Choc Factory // Williamsburg
description:
What better way to explore a city than by discovering its cuisine first hand? Put on a chef's hat for the day and learn how to make classic dishes, local specialties and impressive plates with our expert hosts. Sign up for one of our fun, immersive cooking classes and discover a new hidden talent!

Virginia, our French chocolate expert will welcome you in her exceptional location in the Williamsburg neighborhood; a real chocolate factory /store/ coffeeshop. Upon arrival, you will be given either a hot or iced chocolate with a twist. Once warmed up and while getting to know each others you will be given the opportunity to admire the factory/store. You will then be whisked away and given a brief history of chocolate while also learning about some of the processes involved with chocolate making. Virginia will then guide you through the “ Making Ganache” demo, teaching you everything from scratch, as well showing you how to be creative with a traditional recipe. You will then your own truffles while realizing how a simple recipe can be molded into something as unique as your imagination. Not only you will be able to add your own flavors and topping, but your own feelings into your personal creations.

name: Chocolate Easter Thin Bark Making // Williamsburg
description:
What better way to explore a city than by discovering its cuisine first hand? Put on a chef's hat for the day and learn how to make classic dishes, local specialties and impressive plates with our expert hosts. Sign up for one of our fun, immersive cooking classes and discover a new hidden talent!

Welcome to a lovely chocolate factory in the heart of Williamsburg. First you will be greeted by Virginia, our experienced French specialist who will guide you through the whole experience. You will be welcomed with an authentic hot or iced chocolate with a twist. This may also be the perfect time to indulge in your favorite bottle if you feel the need to. (BYOB) You will learn a little about the history of the brand which hails from the Dominican Republic .You will be whisked away through a brief history of chocolate which spans centuries, while also learning about some of the processes involved with chocolate making. Virginia will then guide you through the “Making Bar Demo", teaching you everything from scratch, as well showing you how to be creative with a traditional recipe. Virginia will be there with you every step of the way, entertaining you with fun facts and answers to all questions.

name: Doughnut & History Tour // Williamsburg
description:
Join the latest culinary trend of immersive and social dining where local hosts invite you into their homes for a magical meal.

The Doughnut & History Tour of Williamsburg is the perfect way to explore the history, culture and sights of this iconic neighborhood. Starting at Doughnut Plant followed by a walk through McCarren Park, the tour will introduce participants to the vibrant and unique about the area's unique cultural heritage and the history behind its architectural and culinary landmarks. The tour will take guests to four donut locations, where they can sample the delicious treats that have become synonymous with Brooklyn. These stops will feature the best donuts in the borough, from classic favorites to unique creations. Along the way, participants will learn about the history of the places they visit and gain a deeper appreciation for the area's culture and people. The tour will conclude at Peter Pan Doughnuts, one of Brooklyn's most beloved donut shops. Guests will be able to purchase freshly made treats and learn more about the bakery's connection to the area. After a sweet and informative tour, guests will be sure to have a new appreciation for Brooklyn and a newfound love of its donuts.

name: Multi-course Italian Dinner Party in the East Village (Wine Included)
description:
Join the latest culinary trend of immersive and social dining where local hosts invite you into their homes for a magical meal.

Experience Italian Comfort in the East Village.
What to expect:

• 5-course Italian classics
• Wine included, guests are encouraged to BYOB
• Known for its artistic vibes and posh boutiques, the East Village is a must-visit neighborhood in New York
• Communal table that seats 10
• Can cater to vegetarian options upon request

About your Host Matteo:

"Born in the countryside of Milan, I acquired a passion for urban farming, nature and cooking (of course!). Join me in the popular New York neighborhood of the East Village and get a taste of real Italian classics."

name: 1 pm Turkish Coffee + Fortune Telling Experience in the East Village
description:
Turkish coffee reading is an authentic tradition dating back to the Ottoman empire of the 1600s. After drinking this sweet, espresso-like coffee, it is customary to read one's fortune from the remaining coffee grinds.

What to expect:
• Turkish style coffee prepared on a pot of hot burning sand
• A visual fortune-telling experience unlike any other. Your coffee grinds are interpreted right before your eyes!
• These readings are always fun, light-hearted, but most importantly - insightful!
• Handcrafted JuJu Turkish Delights & sweets offered
• A unique gift to take home by Dr. Honeybrew

*Per Turkish tradition, each session will consist of 6-8 guests*

name: Brooklyn Pizza Walk in Williamsburg
description:
Join the latest culinary trend of immersive and social dining where local hosts invite you into their homes for a magical meal.

On my Brooklyn Pizza Walk, I am showing you the most eclectic neighborhood in Brooklyn: Williamsburg! While we're walking through this trendy neighborhood, I'll introduce you to five very different styles of pizza. You'll find out what makes each of this pizzerias special, and you'll learn about the history of pizza in New York City.
This tour includes:

-Six different types of pizza in five pizza shops
-A guided tour of Williamsburg, Brooklyn
-Lots of interesting pizza history, trivia and facts!

name: East Village Ice Cream Crawl // Lower East Side
description:
Discover a different side to a city on an immersive food walk and market tours. Our local hosts will show you all their favorite places to eat, drink and have fun!

* All ice cream included * Toasted Sesame Nutella. Salty Caramel. Honey Comb. Cereal Milk. Peppermint Chocolate. Brooklyn Brown Sugar Chunk. Thai Iced Tea. Earl Gray Tea. Oreo Cookie Dough. Cake Batter. Ginger. We stop at six different world-class New York City ice cream shops on this 1.5 mile 1.5 hour tour. At each ice cream store we'll explore the story behind the business and see what makes these frozen desserts unique as you savor every flavor. You'll learn about an ex drug dealer who turned his life around through culinary creativity, an ice cream shop that's been passed down in a family through generations, and a translator who found her real calling. A picture is worth a thousand words, but a scoop of ice cream tells a story. While exploring the East Village we hit the best ice cream shops and taste no fewer than 12 flavors based on a mix of my experience and your interest.

name: Chocolate Mousse Making Class // Williamsburg
description:
What better way to explore a city than by discovering its cuisine first hand? Put on a chef's hat for the day and learn how to make classic dishes, local specialties and impressive plates with our expert hosts. Sign up for one of our fun, immersive cooking classes and discover a new hidden talent!

Upon arrival, Virginia, our French chocolate expert will welcome you with a hot or iced chocolate with a twist and once warmed up while getting to know others - you'll be given the opportunity to admire the factory/store. Virginia will then guide you through the “ Making ”Demo, teaching you everything from scratch, as well showing you how to be creative with a traditional recipe. You will then make your own creation, while soon realizing how a simple recipe can be molded into something as unique as your imagination. Not only will you be able to add your own flavors and toppings, but your own feelings into your personal creations. Virginia will be there every step of the way, entertaining you with fun facts and answers to all your questions. Then, if time is on our side you will be whisked for an amazing tour!

name: Learn How To Make Authentic Fresh Pasta // East Village
description:
Join the latest culinary trend of immersive and social dining where local hosts invite you into their homes for a magical meal.

Experience a taste of Italy in the East Village with host Rachael. Each guest will learn how to make fresh pasta from start to finish in her beautiful pre-war apartment and everyone will work together to pick a custom pasta shape and sauce for dinner with a seasonal appetizer. Please BYOB! Whether it's a date night, girls night out, or you're just trying something new you will take away skills that you can surely use to impress your next dinner party, family and friends!

name: Chocolate Bonbon making in a chocolate factory // Williamsburg
description:
What better way to explore a city than by discovering its cuisine first hand? Put on a chef's hat for the day and learn how to make classic dishes, local specialties and impressive plates with our expert hosts. Sign up for one of our fun, immersive cooking classes and discover a new hidden talent!

Upon arrival, Virginia, our French chocolate expert will welcome you with a hot or iced chocolate with a twist and once warmed up while getting to know others - you'll be given the opportunity to admire the factory/store. Virginia will then guide you through the “ Making ”Demo, teaching you everything from scratch, as well showing you how to be creative with a traditional recipe. You will then make your own creation, while soon realizing how a simple recipe can be molded into something as unique as your imagination. Not only will you be able to add your own flavors and toppings, but your own feelings into your personal creations. Virginia will be there every step of the way, entertaining you with fun facts and answers to all your questions. Then, if time is on our side you will be whisked for an amazing tour!

name: Turkish Coffee & Fortune Telling // East Village
description:
Turkish coffee reading is an authentic tradition dating back to the Ottoman empire of the 1600s. After drinking this sweet, espresso-like coffee, it is customary to read one's fortune from the remaining coffee grinds.

Join Dr. Honeybrew in his quirky East Village apartment for a visual fortune-telling experience like no other. Your coffee grinds are interpreted right before your eyes! These readings are always fun, light-hearted, but most importantly - insightful! Enjoy handcrafted JuJu Turkish Delights & sweets with Turkish style coffee, prepared on a pot of hot burning sand, and go home with a unique gift to take home from Dr. Honeybrew.

*Per Turkish tradition, each session will consist of 6-8 guests*

name: Handcrafted Chocolate Bar Making // Williamsburg
description:
What better way to explore a city than by discovering its cuisine first hand? Put on a chef's hat for the day and learn how to make classic dishes, local specialties and impressive plates with our expert hosts. Sign up for one of our fun, immersive cooking classes and discover a new hidden talent!

You will be greeted by Virginia, our experienced French specialist who will guide you through the whole night. You will be whisked away for a brief history of chocolate while also learning about some of the processes involved in chocolate making. Virginia will then guide you through the “ Making Bar DEMO, teaching you everything from scratch, as well showing you how to be creative with a traditional recipe. (piping, decor, mold, tempering..) Virginia will be there every step of the way, entertaining you with fun facts and answers to all your questions. BYOB bring your own bottle of wine or beer.

name: New York Classic - Doors Off
description:
This expanded 30-minute doors-off helicopter flight allows you to customize your flight path and cover all of Manhattan at once for the ultimate NYC aerial photography experience. 



 



Take off from New Jersey and enjoy the breathtaking views of New Jerseys skyline. After a safety briefing and pre-flight check, you'll embark on your 30-minute adventure.  



 



On the program: 





  • Statue of Liberty




  • Chrysler Building 




  • Battery Park




  • Ellis Island




  • Wall St 




  • Freedom Tower 




  • 9/11 Memorial 




  • The Oculus




  • Lower Manhattan Monet Shot




  • Brooklyn Bridge




  • Empire State Building 




  • Midtown




  • Times Square




  • The Vessel




  • Central Park




  • The Bronx




  • Yankee Stadium 




  • Hudson River 




  • New Jersey Shoreline




  • The Palisades 




  • New York Harbor 




  • Jersey City




  • The George Washington Bridge 




  • And more! 





 



So what are you waiting for? Book your doors-off sightseeing helicopter flight today and don't forget your camera! 



 



 



Show up 1h15 before takeoff for check-in.



Take the NJ Path train to Journal Square in Jersey City or NJ Transit to Newark Penn Station, then take an Uber or cab to the hangar.

name: Doors off helicopter New York
description:
Considering a doors-off photo flight above NYC, but never been in a helicopter before? We have the perfect trial run for you to test the air and soar above the southern tip of Manhattan. The iconic shots you know so well from movies and TV are now yours for the taking. Book your seat on the NYC Intro flight: a 16-minute doors-on flight that delivers Lady Liberty, Ellis Island, the Freedom Tower, and the historic waterfront of Battery Park. Whether you are capturing photos or simply enjoying the view, these gems of New York Harbor will captivate your senses and leave a lasting impression

  • Statue of Liberty
  • Ellis Island
  • Governor’s Island
  • Freedom Tower
  • Brooklyn Bridge
  • Verrazano-Narrow Bridge
  • Lower Manhattan
  • And so much more…

After seeing the skyline from this unique vantage point and feeling the comfort and security of our award-winning safety protocol, we know you will be back for more! You might even opt for the doors off next time!

Come on…what are you waiting for?

All passengers need to arrive 1 hour and 15-minutes prior to their flight.

Book your 16-minute flight today and we’ll take care of the rest.

name: Feast of San Gennaro
shortDescription: The Feast of San Gennaro, dubbed "The Feast of all Feasts," celebrates the life of San Gennaro of Naples who was the Bishop of Benevento, Italy. In 1926, a one-day block party continued year after year into something that has now and for decades become not only a New York icon but a world-known 11-day event that stretches throughout 11 blocks of Little Italy's neighborhood.
description: The Feast of San Gennaro, dubbed "The Feast of all Feasts," celebrates the life of San Gennaro of Naples who was the Bishop of Benevento, Italy. In 1926, a one-day block party continued year after year into something that has now and for decades become not only a New York icon but a world-known 11-day event that stretches throughout 11 blocks of Little Italy's neighborhood.

name: Village Halloween Parade
shortDescription: Hailed as the largest celebration of its kind, the Annual Village Halloween Parade draws over 60,000 costumed participants each year. The parade will stimulate all your senses as thrilling and eye-catching costumes, puppets, and floats are showcased to celebrate Halloween. Participate in the parade or join over two million spectators and watch in excitement as the costumes and floats slink by at the Annual Village Halloween Parade.
description: Hailed as the largest celebration of its kind, the Annual Village Halloween Parade draws over 60,000 costumed participants each year. The parade will stimulate all your senses as thrilling and eye-catching costumes, puppets, and floats are showcased to celebrate Halloween. Participate in the parade or join over two million spectators and watch in excitement as the costumes and floats slink by at the Annual Village Halloween Parade.

name: New Year’s Eve at Times Square
shortDescription: Watching the ball dop each year as the clock nears midnight on December 31, is more than just a celebration -- it's a global tradition. Experience the dazzling lights and bustling energy of Times Square while the world counts down at the symbolic center of New York City.
description: Watching the ball dop each year as the clock nears midnight on December 31, is more than just a celebration -- it's a global tradition. Experience the dazzling lights and bustling energy of Times Square while the world counts down at the symbolic center of New York City.

name: New York Helicopter
description:
Welcome to the Great Flight of New York, you have already visited the city countless times, seen and visited the buildings, the most attractive monuments.



But have you ever visited New York from the air? We offer you a unique experience with this 28 minute helicopter tour.  



With constantly changing lighting conditions and customized itineraries, the flights are never the same twice. 



 



On the program:





  • Statue of Liberty




  • Ellis Island                                                                




  • The Jenga Building




  • Yankee Stadium




  • Governor's Island




  • Brooklyn Bridge




  • Manhattan Bridge




  • Verrazano-Narrow Bridge




  • Williamsburg Bridge




  • Queensboro Bridge




  • Battery Park




  • Freedom Tower




  • Financial District




  • Flatiron Building




  • Oculus




  • 9/11 Memorial




  • Wall Street




  • Hudson Yards




  • Times Square




  • Central Park




  • Empire State Building




  • Chrysler Building




  • United Nations Building




  • Roosevelt Island




  • The New Yorker Building




  • Madison Square Garden





 



What are you waiting for? 



Book your flight today and we'll take care of the rest. 



 



 



Show up 1 hour and 15 minutes before departure for check-in.



Take the NJ Path train to Journal Square in Jersey City or NJ Transit to Newark Penn Station, then take an Uber or cab to the hangar.

name: New York helicopter tour
description:
Take on the world's most iconic flight: NEW YORK. 



 



Embark on a flight over Manhattan. Your trip to New York wouldn't be complete without flying over the Statue of Liberty, one of New York's top tourist spots! You'll fly over New York Harbor, the 150-year-old Brooklyn Bridge, South Street Harbor, Governors Island, and Ellis Island.



 



You will continue towards Hudson and enjoy incredible views of downtown Manhattan such as the Chrysler and Empire State Buildings, Chelsea Piers, Jacob Javits Convention Center, Intrepid Sea, Air and Space Museum and Central Park. The return flight will be to the iconic One World Trade Center. 



 



Enjoy an incredible 15 minutes flight to New York's must-see attraction.

name: Una Cena Italiana: An Italian Feast // Park Slope
description:
Join the latest culinary trend of immersive and social dining where local hosts invite you into their homes for a magical meal.

Italian-inspired feast with locally-sourced ingredients used to cater to the season! Stacia, will begin the evening with light bites and a welcome cocktail followed by an additional 3 - courses. Come dine with friends or come alone to meet new friends, anyone is welcome at the table. Please be sure to arrive with your appetite! This event is BYOB!

name: Winter Raclette
description:
Join the latest culinary trend of immersive and social dining where local hosts invite you into their homes for a magical meal.

This dinner is an interactive, traditionally French meal where raclette cheese is melted on a grill and served alongside crispy potatoes, charcuterie and vegetables. This is a cultural experience you won't want to miss! What to expect: This is an interactive French meal where we melt our raclette cheese on the grill alongside veggies, charcuterie, crispy potatoes, and fresh baguette. This is a typical winter meal to occurs in the Alps and the French countryside. It is a cultural experience you won't want to miss! Please feel free to bring wine to accompany the experience!

name: Handmade Italian  Pasta Cooking Class // Brooklyn
description:
What better way to explore a city than by discovering its cuisine first hand? Put on a chef's hat for the day and learn how to make classic dishes, local specialties and impressive plates with our expert hosts. Sign up for one of our fun, immersive cooking classes and discover a new hidden talent!

Do you want to know how to cook a real fresh Italian pasta with all the tricks that made Italy the country of Pasta? I’m going to teach you all the knowledge that my family (especially my grandmother) passed down to me since I was very little. We are going to start off with touching and knowing the right ingredients (imported from Italy), and then get ready to get your hands really dirty! We are going to prepare two kinds of pasta: tortelli filled with fresh local ricotta and spinach, and tagliatelle. While mixing with your hands, we cheers with unlimited wine to good food and good company! While we are waiting for the pasta dough to rest we will enjoy a real Italian aperitivo with a charcuterie board. Salute! Both the hosts are covid 19 vaccinated (both doses - Moderna vaccine) If you feel sick or you have been in contact with somebody with Covid-19 stay home please . I will sanitize the workspace and restroom space prior to the class, but keep in mind there is only one bathroom. To finish off the evening we are going to dine with your just made fresh pasta. This class can’t be suitable for Gluten Free. Is this your first Eatwith experience? Use the code 06AB9560 to get 12$ off at checkout! About your host Michela: “I moved to Brooklyn into my husbands’ grandparents’ 100-year-old home from my home town in Brisighella, Italy, right out Tuscany. My perspective of food is ancient and respectful of each ingredient I use in my meals, just as my grandparents taught me. Guests can expect homemade family recipes passed down through the ages.”

name: 5-Course Mexican Feast with Wine & Mezcal Pairing in Brooklyn
description:
Join the latest culinary trend of immersive and social dining where local hosts invite you into their homes for a magical meal.

Michelin-trained Chef duo Pablo and Roxy invite you in to their home for a 6-course contemporary Mexican feast with Mexican wine and mezcal pairings in the heart of Brooklyn. The menu changes seasonally based on what is available at local markets. Can cater to vegetarian, vegan, and gluten free diets. A free pick-up and drop-off service is offered from the King's Highway Station to the chefs home.

name: A Social Dinning Experiment Around The World!
description:
Join the latest culinary trend of immersive and social dining where local hosts invite you into their homes for a magical meal.

Indulge in a social dining experience that will take you around the world. Professionally trained Chef Marie will give you a crash course in 5 different cultures. You will experience a 5 - course tasting menu specializing and focusing on seasonal favorites. For each course, you will experience the taste of a different culture with an optional wine pairing that will surely have your taste buds dancing. This will be an experience that will leave you in awe and wanting to come back for more. This experience will in a decorated venue space with lots of lights and music.
About Marie:
Chef Marie, has always had a passion for culinary arts and has worked in a numerous restaurants under many execute chefs serving different kinds of cuisines. She has had several chef mentors, and has performed in restaurant showcases. She continues to pursue her dreams by providing authentic dishes to family, friends, and people in her local community.

name: Six Sensational Courses In A Modern Brooklyn Studio
description:
The Pimento experience and studio highlights the traditional aesthetics of Caribbean cuisine by presenting a new wave of seasonal dishes. The family-style menu is a modern take on a Caribbean family dinner featuring a curated medley of seasonal produce and fresh ingredients. To compliment the experience, Chef Tiyan has paired signature beverages to mirror the menu, which allows the distinct flavors to shine.
• Family-style menu
• Seasonal produce and fresh ingredients
• Paired signature beverages to mirror the menu
• Enjoy a 6-course meal in a modern culinary studio

About your host, Toya: undefined

name: Oyster Hour on Pier 44 in Red Hook
description: Enjoy fresh, local oysters against a backdrop of the New York City skyline. Pier 44 is located in Brooklyn on the Hudson River, near the Waterfront Museum, Red Hook Winery, and walking distance from the Red Hook Ferry. Learn about the history of oysters in NYC while indulging a variety oyster raw bar from Long Island and the northeastern coast.

name: No Diet Club: Best Food in Downtown Brooklyn // Cobble Hill
description:
Join the latest culinary trend of immersive and social dining where local hosts invite you into their homes for a magical meal.

After shining light on the best foods all over Europe since 2017, your favorite group of French foodies at the No Diet Club have decided to expand across the pond. Guided by a local foodie, this tour features a 4 hour tribute to NYC’s most iconic and historically relevant foods such as finest ingredients pizza by the slice, chopped cheese, authentic beef patties, fluffy doughnuts and many more, as well as a gorgeous stroll among the historical Brownstone townhomes in the culturally eclectic borough of Brooklyn. Tastings may vary with the seasons / vegetarians are welcome What we offer ✔ - Many tastings to share - Calories - A nice walk in Brooklyn - What locals eat - Lots of fun - Funny/bad jokes - Pictures and souvenirs - Smiles - A list of serious recommendations in NYC - New friends from all around the world

name: Fly high for an extended view of the city
description:
Fly high for an extended view of the city.



The Big Apple tour includes all the spectacular views you'll see in The Manhattan, with the addition of the stunning vistas of the New Jersey Palisades, the engineering marvel of the double-decker George Washington Bridge and more. 



On the program:





  • Central Park




  • Columbia University 




  • Yankee Stadium (unavailable during games) 




  • New Jersey Palisades 




  • George Washington Bridge 




  • Statue of Liberty 




  • Freedom Tower 




  • Chrysler Building 




  • Empire State Building 




  • Chelsea Piers




  • Intrepid Sea, Air & Space Museum

name: Multi-Course Mexican Tasting Menu // Harlem
description:
Join the latest culinary trend of immersive and social dining where local hosts invite you into their homes for a magical meal.

Professional Chef Karina and husband Lalo welcome you in to their home for a multi-course Mexican tasting menu. Karina's experience brings the vibrant flavors and sounds of Mexico to life in the heart of Harlem. Get a taste of traditional Mexican cuisine without leaving NYC! The intimate experience kicks off with a spicy mezcal margarita with smoked salt, before guests are seated around Karina's communal dining table. The multi-course tasting menu is prepared with love, using imported ingredients from Mexico and locally sourced produce from Union Square Market. Karina is a true story-teller and will regale you with tales of her trips to Mexico and share the inspirations behind each dish.

name: New York Presbyterian Hospital-Columbia: Cancer Center
Japanese/American-style Sushi Workshop // Upper East Side
description:
What better way to explore a city than by discovering its cuisine first hand? Put on a chef's hat for the day and learn how to make classic dishes, local specialties and impressive plates with our expert hosts. Sign up for one of our fun, immersive cooking classes and discover a new hidden talent!

Professional Chef Diego invites you to his beautiful Upper East Side apartment for a hands-on, interactive cooking class, learning to make the very best Sushi in the city! Each guest will have their own work station and tools, as well as ingredients. Diego will teach you step-by-step how to make the perfect sushi - from making the sushi rice, to cutting the fish, to rolling the sushi. You will make salmon rolls, seasonal nigiri and sashimi. After rolling and mastering your sushi technique, guests will sit down and enjoy their sushi creations. This is perfect for date nights as well as groups of friends. Don't miss out on this incredible experience!

name: Chinese Dumplings Cooking Class // Upper East Side
description:
What better way to explore a city than by discovering its cuisine first hand? Put on a chef's hat for the day and learn how to make classic dishes, local specialties and impressive plates with our expert hosts. Sign up for one of our fun, immersive cooking classes and discover a new hidden talent!

Professional Chef Diego invites you to his beautiful Upper East Side apartment for a hands-on, interactive cooking class, learning to make the very best Chinese Dumplings in the city! Each guest will have their own work station and tools, as well as ingredients to make this beautiful yet delicious labor of love. Diego will take you step-by-step in mastering the gentle art of preparing and folding dumplings as well as learning how to make the other half of the dumpling - the dipping sauce. Diego will share his top tips and trick in the kitchen and teach you important knife skills. You will make TWO types of dumplings - one pork filled and one vegetarian, and he will show you how to prepare them fried and steamed.

name: Homemade Gnocchi Workshop // Upper East Side
description:
What better way to explore a city than by discovering its cuisine first hand? Put on a chef's hat for the day and learn how to make classic dishes, local specialties and impressive plates with our expert hosts. Sign up for one of our fun, immersive cooking classes and discover a new hidden talent!

Professional Chef Diego invites you to his beautiful Upper East Side apartment for a hands-on, interactive fun cooking class, learning to master the technique of making a classic potato gnocchi dough recipe from start to finish. Each guest will have their own work station and tools, as well as ingredients. Diego will teach you step-by-step how to form the perfect potato gnocchi accompanied with two seasonal sauces: a mushroom sauce and a herb & garlic butter sauce. Diego will provide special tips to give your gnocchi that special, professional-level touch that will surely surprise your family and friends at your next dinner party. At the end of class, you will sit down to enjoy your handmade gnocchi paired with each type of sauce. This is perfect for date nights as well as groups of friends. Don't miss out on this incredible experience!

name: Peruvian Ceviche Cooking Class // Upper East Side
description:
What better way to explore a city than by discovering its cuisine first hand? Put on a chef's hat for the day and learn how to make classic dishes, local specialties and impressive plates with our expert hosts. Sign up for one of our fun, immersive cooking classes and discover a new hidden talent!

Professional Chef Diego invites you to his beautiful Upper East Side apartment for a hands-on, interactive cooking class, learning his take on traditional Peruvian ceviche. Each guest will have their own work station and tools, as well as ingredients. Diego will teach you how to select the perfect cut of fish as well as break it down, the vegetables and ingredients and many special tips and secrets on how to create your perfect ceviche dish. You will also be taught how to make Leche de Tigre, which is made from the scraps of the ceviche dish. There is no waste in host Diego's kitchen. At the end of class, you will sit down to enjoy your ceviche dish paired with the Leche De Tigre. This is perfect for date nights as well as groups of friends. Don't miss out on this incredible experience!

name: Museum of the City of New York
Discover Manhattan from the sky !
description:
Take to the air for an unforgettable view of the city that never sleeps. 



 



Soar over Manhattan's skyline to see the beauty of the city, from an up-close view of Lady Liberty to the breathtaking sight of the Freedom Tower. 



 



Your flight will take you up to the Hudson River for an aerial view of Manhattan's most famous sites, including : 



 





  • Statue of Liberty 




  • Ellis Island




  • Freedom Tower 




  • Chrysler Building 




  • Empire State Building 




  • Chelsea Piers 




  • Intrepid Sea, Air & Space Museum

name: Taquiza
description:
Join the latest culinary trend of immersive and social dining where local hosts invite you into their homes for a magical meal.

Enjoy this first ever taquiza in NY by the owners of Taqueria Chingon, arguably one of the best taco shops in Illinois! They are here for one weekend only!
Hosted by Eric, local foodie and taco addict eager to share some taco knowledge with you!

Spacious & private outdoor space. An ever growing plant collection that is a great contrast to the industrial area our apartment is located in!

name: Traditional Turkish Brunch // Bed-Stuy
description: Join host Shycook for this traditional Turkish brunch in the heart of Bed-Stuy, Brooklyn. All charcuterie is imported directly from Turkey with the exception of the jams that are homemade with locally - sourced ingredients. The pastries are also homemade with traditional Turkish ingredients. This experience is a family - style setting with shared plates.

name: Cooking Without a Recipe: Class & Tasting // Bed-Stuy
description:
What better way to explore a city than by discovering its cuisine first hand? Put on a chef's hat for the day and learn how to make classic dishes, local specialties and impressive plates with our expert hosts. Sign up for one of our fun, immersive cooking classes and discover a new hidden talent!

Chef Courtney teaches you how to cook with “self-possession”—in other words, don’t just follow recipes, understand how to build flavor and create texture with any basket of ingredients. Chef Courtney was an instructor at the Chef Studio, the lauded cooking school of her late mentor Robert Reynolds. You will learn not only from Chef Courtney’s experience as chef/owner of Din Din, but from Chef Reynold’s years of study with celebrated French chef Madeline Kamman. We will: Sit to review what we’ll be cooking Cook each dish hands-on in teams, including group-wide demonstrations of each key element Sit to taste what we cooked, discussing what we learned Wine and sparkling mineral water included!

name: Mexican Tapas and Craft Cocktails Experience in BK
description:
Join the latest culinary trend of immersive and social dining where local hosts invite you into their homes for a magical meal.

Happy Hour on a Brooklyn Rooftop!
Celebrate summer with tasty grilled Mexican tapas inspired by Chef Gabriel travels in Mexico; and enjoy tequila craft cocktails tasting shaken by acclaimed mixologist Gaston Ron.
What to expect:
• Enjoy Mexican tapas with a modern twist!
• Welcomed with your choice of 3 Tequila Craft cocktails
• Beautiful cozy Brooklyn rooftop in Bed Stuy
• Lounge setting, pass around tapas, have fun with friends or make new ones. Great for groups of 4 or larger
• Wrap-up your evening with homemade flan
• Casual atmosphere - mi casa es tu casa - feel like at home!

name: New York deluxe flight - Manhattan
description:
Take a 30-minute helicopter tour of New York City. This flight offers an aerial view of Manhattan and its surroundings.



 



Take off in a southerly direction where you will fly over the Verrazzano Bridge, the longest suspension bridge in America that connects Brooklyn and Staten Island. You can spot Coney Island in the distance before turning around for a spectacular view of Manhattan across New York Harbor. 



Enjoy an incredible view of the Statue of Liberty and the splendid architecture of the Chrysler Building, from the Empire State Building. You will continue north to New York's most famous neighborhood, passing the George Washington Bridge which connects Manhattan and New Jersey.



Explore the expanse of the 5 boroughs as you descend Hudson past Yankee Stadium, Central Park, Intrepid Sea, Air & Space Museum and One World Trade Center to New York Harbor.



 



New York's most comprehensive flight. Memorable memories guaranteed!

name: Macy’s Firework Spectacular
shortDescription: Costing nearly nine million dollars only on the fireworks, this 25-minute spectacle is synchronized to a rousing musical score and will feature a host of shells and effects in 30 colors and shapes. The Macy's 4th of July Fireworks have been a New York City tradition since 1976.
description: Costing nearly nine million dollars only on the fireworks, this 25-minute spectacle is synchronized to a rousing musical score and will feature a host of shells and effects in 30 colors and shapes. The Macy's 4th of July Fireworks have been a New York City tradition since 1976.

name: Helicopter tour in New York from Manhattan
description:
Take off for the most popular tour and see Manhattan Island in its full glory!



 



This 17-20 minute flight gives you the best view of Manhattan. This flight takes you north over the George Washington Bridge, one of the busiest bridges in the world.



Discover the best view of Manhattan including the Statue of Liberty, Central Park, the Empire State Building and One World Trade Center.



Discover Central Park along its entire length, Columbia University or the historic Grant's Tomb, the largest mausoleum in North America! Fly over the beautiful cliffs of New Jersey or Inwood Hill Park in northern Manhattan, the last natural forest in this urban metropolis!



Continue to Yankee Stadium, flying over Hudson.



 



Enjoy a memorable flight and discover New York from the sky!

name: Lincoln Center for the Performing Arts
Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade
shortDescription: Line the parade route with millions of others to marvel at the big balloons floating down 34th Street at the Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade. Live music and performances include high school marching bands from around the nation, cheerleaders and dancers that are chosen by the National Cheerleaders Association, and the Rockettes from Radio City Music Hall. Stare in anticipation as Santa rolls to Herald Square and kicks off the holiday shopping season at the Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade.
description: Line the parade route with millions of others to marvel at the big balloons floating down 34th Street at the Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade. Live music and performances include high school marching bands from around the nation, cheerleaders and dancers that are chosen by the National Cheerleaders Association, and the Rockettes from Radio City Music Hall. Stare in anticipation as Santa rolls to Herald Square and kicks off the holiday shopping season at the Macy's Thanksgiving Day Parade.

name: Radio City Music Hall Stage Door Tour
